headline: US Senate candidate Dave McCormick campaigns in York, Lancaster counties
author: Barbara Barr
sentences: "I think we're here because of a bunch of weak decisions that were made over the last year, namely the debacle in Afghanistan and then the energy policy that really made the United States a net energy importer and really empowered Putin.

McCormick and Dr. Mehmet Oz are spending millions on nonstop television ads but are also meeting voters in person in the Susquehanna Valley, an indication of how crucial the area will be to winning the May primary.
Dave McCormick, who is seen as one of the front runners for the seat being vacated by Pat Toomey, made stops Monday in Lancaster and York counties.

LANCASTER, Pa. â€”
The Susquehanna Valley is getting plenty of attention from Republican candidates for U.S. Senate.
So, I think, unfortunately, we're here because of the terrible decisions of the Biden administration," he said.
McCormick spoke with voters at Starlight Diner in Hanover and toured a manufacturing business.
He also held a town hall at the Spring House Brewing Company in Lancaster.
News 8's Barbara Barr asked him about the crisis in Ukraine.
